text: The 18th Central Committee of the All-Union Communist Party (Bolsheviks) was elected by the 18th Conference, and was in session from 1941 until 1952. ==Plenums== * 1st Plenary Session (5 May 1941) * 2nd Plenary Session (27 January 1944) * 3rd Plenary Session (11, 14 18 March 1946) * 4th Plenary Session (21–22, 24, 26 February 1947) * 5th Plenary Session (15 August 1952) ==Composition== ===Regular members=== * Andrey Andreyev (1895–1971) * Vasily Andrianov (1902–1978) * Mir Jafar Baghirov (1896–1956) * Alexey Badayev (1883–1951) * Lavrentiy Beria (1899–1953) * Gennady Borkov (1905–1983) * Semyon Budyonny (1883–1973) * Nikolai Bulganin (1895–1975) * Mykhailo Burmystenko (1902–1941) * Boris Vannikov (1897–1962) * Vasily Vahrushev (1902–1947) * Nikolai Voznesensky (1903–1950) * Kliment Voroshilov (1881–1969) * Andrey Vyshinsky (1883–1954) * Boris Dvinskiy (1894–1973 * Vladimir Dekanozov (1898–1953) * Vladimir Donskoi (1903–1954) * Aleksandr Yefremov (1904–1951) * Andrei Zhdanov (1896–1948) * Simon Zadionchenko (1898–1972) * Simon Zhakarov (1906–1986) * Arseny Zverev (1900–1969) * Rozaliya Zemlyachka (1876–1947) * Lazar Kaganovich (1883–1991) * Mikhail Kaganovich (1888–1941) * Mikhail Kalinin (1875–1946) * Leonid Korniyets (1901–1969) * Demyan Korotchenko (1894–1969) * Alexei Kosygin (1904–1980) * Alexey Kuznetsov (1905–1950) * Nikolay Kuznetsov (1902–1974) * Grigory Kulik (1890–1950) * Otto Wilhelm Kuusinen (1881–1964) * Solomon Lozovsky (1892–1952) * Pyotr Lyubavin (1896–1941) * Georgy Malenkov (1902–1988) * Vyacheslav Malyshev (1902–1957) * Dmitry Manuilsky (1883–1959) * Vsevolod Merkulov (1895–1953) * Lev Mehlis (1889–1953) * Anastas Mikoyan (1895–1978) * Mark Mitin (1901–1987) * Nikolay Mikhailov (1906–1982) * Vyacheslav Molotov (1890–1986) * Vladimir Niktin (1907–1959) * Klavdiya Nikolayeva (1893–1944) * Nikolai Patolichev (1908–1989) * Nikolai Pegov (1905–1991) * Mikhail Pervukhin (1904–1978) * Ponomarenko Panteleimon (1902–1984) * Georgy Popov (1906–1968) * Alexander Poskrebyshev (1891–1965) * Pyotr Pospelov (1898–1979) * Vladimir Potemkin (1874–1946) * Vasily Pronin (1905–1993) * Ivan Rogov (1899–1949) * Ivan Sedin (1899–1949) * Nikolay Skvortsov (1899–1974) * Joseph Stalin (1878–1953) * Mikhail Suslov (1902–1982) * Ivan Tevosian (1902–1958) * Semyon Timoshenko (1895–1970) * Alexander Fadeyev (1901–1956) * Nikita Khrushchev (1894–1971) * Alexei Shakurin (1904–1975) * Nikolay Shvernik (1888–1970) * Matvei Shkiryatov (1883–1954) * Grigori Shtern (1900–1941) * Alexander Shcherbakov (1901–1945) * Yusupov Usman (1901–1966) * Yemelyan Yaroslavsky (1878–1943) ===Candidates=== * Georgy Aleksandrov (1908–1961) * Alexander Alemasov (1902–1972) * Joseph Apanasenko (1890–1943) * Grigory Arutyunov (1900–1957) * Sergei Bagayev (1902–1977) * Valerian Bakradze (1901–1971) * Ivan Benediktov (1902–1983) * Ivan Boytsov (1896–1988) * Ivan Vlasov (1903–1969) * Mikhail Gvishiani (1905–1966) * Sergo Goglidze (1911–1988) * Karl Styare (1903–1943?) * Ivan Tyulenev (1892–1978) * Ivan Khokhlov (1895–1973) * Candide Charkviani (1907–1994) * Yakov Cherevichenko (1894–1976) * Boris Chernousov (1908–1978) * Aleksey Chuyanov (1905–1977) * Boris Shaposhnikov (1882–1945) * Terenty Shtykov (1907–1964) * Yefim Shchadenko (1885–1951) * Ivan Yumashev (1895–1972) ==References== Category:Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union Category:1941 establishments in the Soviet Union Category:1952 disestablishments in the Soviet Union
title: Central Committee elected by the 18th Conference of the All-Union Communist Party (Bolsheviks)
